item.title: 辛鲍姆和在美国阴影下成长的挑战
item.description:
墨西哥面临着一个经济转折点：减少对美国的依赖，吸引投资，在不确定的环境中保持财政稳定。【原文：

México enfrenta un punto de inflexión económico: depender menos de EE.UU., atraer inversión y mantener la estabilidad fiscal bajo un entorno incierto.

】

item.title: 让墨西哥比美国发展得更快的机会来了
item.description:
国家正处于十字路口，墨西哥总统的决策将决定经济增长是一飞冲天，还是陷入停滞。【原文：

With the nation at a crossroads, the Mexican president’s decisions will determine whether growth takes off — or becomes mired in stagnation.

】

item.title: OpenAI 正在创建一家公益公司。这意味着什么？
item.description: 经过数月与监管机构和利益相关者的反复沟通，OpenAI 表示已完成重组，成为一家更传统的营利性公司，这是该公司争取获得数十亿美元资金以打造尖端人工智能产品的关键一步。【原文：After months of back-and-forth with regulators and stakeholders, OpenAI said it has completed the process of restructuring as a more traditional, for-profit company – a key step in its bid to secure billions more in capital to build cutting-edge artificial intelligence products.】

item.description: 克利夫兰-克利夫斯公司（Cleveland-Cliffs Inc.【原文：Cleveland-Cliffs Inc. is seeking to raise as much as $982.5 million in a share sale, as the steel and iron-ore pellet producer seeks to pay down debt.】

item.title: ServiceNow 销售额增长强劲，称人工智能有助于削减开支
item.description: ServiceNow 公司展望了强劲的收入增长，并表示人工智能正在帮助公司降低成本。【原文：ServiceNow Inc. gave an outlook for strong revenue growth and said AI is helping the company reduce costs.】

item.title: Meta 计划增加支出，一次性收取税费
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司表示，预计 2026 年的总支出将大幅增加，该公司在数据中心和其他设备上的支出将继续保持历史水平，以推动其在人工智能领域的努力。股价在延时交易中下跌。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. said it expects total expenses to significantly increase in 2026, and the company will continue to spend at historic levels on data centers and other equipment to fuel its effort in artificial intelligence. The shares dropped in extended trading.】

item.title: EBay 公布假日期间盈利前景不佳，股价下跌
item.description: EBay Inc. 公布的第四季度利润预期低于分析师的平均预期，这加剧了投资者对进入假日购物季后利润收窄的担忧。【原文：EBay Inc. gave a profit forecast for the fourth quarter that missed the average analyst estimate, stoking investor concerns about narrowing margins heading into the holiday shopping season.】

item.title: 前档案代理在埃德加数据内幕案中认罪
item.description: 布鲁克林一名男子承认利用客户机密信息进行交易，非法获利 220 多万美元。【原文：A Brooklyn man who worked for a private business that provides services for companies filing to the Securities and Exchange Commission’s Edgar system, pleaded guilty to using confidential client information to make trades that led to more than $2.2 million in illicit profits.】

item.title: 二手车销售创纪录，Carvana 预计业绩将超预期
item.description: 在线二手车零售商 Carvana Co. 的销售额继续创纪录地增长，利润也超过了预期，因此该公司预计全年利润将达到此前预测的上限。【原文：Online used-car retailer Carvana Co. continued to grow sales at record levels and beat profit estimates, leading the company to project full-year profits that will hit the high end of its previous projection.】

item.title: 微软报告数据中心支出激增，股价下滑
item.description: 微软公司报告的支出攀升幅度超出华尔街预期，加剧了人们对提供人工智能基础设施的高成本的担忧。【原文：Microsoft Corp. reported a steeper climb in spending than Wall Street expected, fueling anxieties about the high costs of providing AI infrastructure.】

item.title: MercadoLibre 免运费和信贷扩张影响利润
item.description: MercadoLibre 公司第三季度的净收入未能达到分析师的预期，尽管该公司在巴西扩大了免费送货政策并不断增加信用卡产品，从而带来了收入的增长。【原文：MercadoLibre Inc.’s third quarter net income missed analysts’ estimates despite a jump in revenue from the company’s expansion of its free shipping policies in Brazil and the ongoing growth of its credit card offerings.】

item.title: 谷歌云计算部门增长，Alphabet 销售额超预期
item.description: 随着人工智能初创公司寻求谷歌的支持和计算能力，云计算部门的业绩也在不断增长。【原文：Alphabet Inc. reported quarterly sales that beat analysts’ estimates, buoyed by the performance of its cloud unit, which is growing as artificial intelligence startups seek Google’s support and computing power.】

item.title: 德意志银行美国不良资产业务部盈利 2 亿美元
item.description: 据一位知情人士透露，在截至 9 月 30 日的三个月里，德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）的美国不良资产交易柜台净赚约 2 亿美元，这也是交易热潮的一部分，帮助推动这家德国银行在第三季度取得了创纪录的收益。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG’s US distressed trading desk netted about $200 million in profit during the three months ending Sep. 30, according to a person with knowledge of the matter, part of a trading boom that helped drive record third-quarter gains for the German bank.】

item.title: 阿根廷大选后抛售债务热潮将提振阿根廷比索
item.description: 随着哈维尔-米莱伊总统在中期选举中获胜，阿根廷各省和公司正排队准备在未来几周内开拓全球市场，这将为该国打开一扇出售债务的窗口，从而为该国的外汇市场带来急需的美元。【原文：Argentine provinces and companies are lining up to tap global markets in the next few weeks as President Javier Milei’s win in midterm elections fuels optimism about the country, opening a window for debt sales that could bring much needed dollars into the nation’s foreign-exchange market.】

item.title: 马斯克律师誓言通过法律斗争解除 OpenAI 的重组
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克的律师抨击加利福尼亚州和特拉华州的总检察长没有阻止这家人工智能初创公司重组为营利性公司，并承诺将继续这位亿万富翁对 OpenAI 的法律讨伐。【原文：Elon Musk’s lawyer pledged to continue the billionaire’s legal crusade against OpenAI as he slammed the attorneys general of California and Delaware for not blocking the artificial intelligence startup’s restructuring as a for-profit company.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长拉加德称否决权挟持了 "脆弱 "的欧盟
item.description: 欧洲中央银行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）再次呼吁改革欧盟内部的决策方式，推动以多数表决方式改善欧盟的运作。【原文：European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde renewed her call to revamp the way decisions are taking within the European Union, pushing for majority voting to improve how the bloc functions.】

item.title: 鲍威尔避免承诺 12 月降息，美元上涨
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）表示，不确定央行是否会在 12 月份的下次会议上再次降息，美元因此上涨。【原文：The dollar rose after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said it’s not certain that the central bank will cut interest rates again at its next meeting in December.】

item.title: 鲍威尔称 12 月降息远非定局
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）表示，12 月再次降息并无保证。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said another rate cut in December is not guaranteed.】

item.title: OpenAI 重组为 IPO 和人工智能消费狂潮铺平道路
item.description: 2024 年末，OpenAI 还在从山姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman）短暂而混乱的下台后的余震中恢复过来，它希望能启动一个相对简单的过程，将公司转变为对投资者更有吸引力的传统营利性企业。然后，反击就来了。【原文：In late 2024, OpenAI, still recovering from the aftershock of the brief, messy ousting of Sam Altman, initiated what it hoped would be a relatively straightforward process of converting to a more traditional for-profit business that would be more appealing to investors. Then came the pushback.】

item.title: 美联储将于 12 月 1 日结束资产负债表清算，以应对融资成本的上升
item.description: 美联储周三表示，将从 12 月 1 日起停止缩减国债持有量，结束长达三年之久的努力。【原文：The Federal Reserve on Wednesday said it will stop shrinking its Treasury holdings beginning Dec. 1, ending a three-year long effort after stress signals in money markets intensified in recent days.】

item.title: 德国首次国家安全会议讨论稀土问题
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，德国总理弗里德里希-默茨将在其新成立的国家安全委员会第一次会议上讨论德国对中国稀土的依赖问题。【原文：German Chancellor Friedrich Merz is set to discuss the country’s dependence on China’s rare earths at the first meeting of his newly formed national security council, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 伊利诺伊州州长普利兹克质疑用亿万富翁税资助公共交通的计划
item.description: 伊利诺伊州州长普利兹克（JB Pritzker）表示，对亿万富翁的资产征税并征收其他税款以帮助为芝加哥地区的交通系统提供资金的提案不会以目前的形式推进。【原文：Illinois Governor JB Pritzker said a proposal to tax billionaires’ assets and enact other levies to help fund the Chicago region’s transit system won’t advance in its current form.】

item.title: 鲍威尔称美联储 12 月减息尚未确定后，美国国债暴跌
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）表示，12 月降息并非板上钉钉，即使在广泛预期的降息四分之一个百分点以支撑劳动力市场之后，美联储主席鲍威尔仍表示，12 月降息并非板上钉钉。【原文：Treasuries extended losses after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said a December interest-rate cut was not set in stone, even after delivering a widely expected quarter-point reduction to prop up the labor market.】

item.title: YouTube 将使用人工智能锐化低分辨率视频
item.description: 谷歌的 YouTube 将利用人工智能来提高其平台上许多低分辨率视频在电视屏幕、网络和移动设备上观看时的视觉清晰度。【原文：Google’s YouTube will use artificial intelligence to improve the visual clarity of many low-resolution videos on its platform when viewed on TV screens, the web and mobile devices.】

item.title: 美联储降息1/4个百分点，资产负债表清算告一段落
